Refractive index of the transparent medium is n.
Light rays enter the shell at the inner surface and refract according to Snell's law.
Light rays incident parallel to the axis will refract towards the normal as they enter the medium.

Snell's law at the inner surface: n1 sin(theta1) = n2 sin(theta2).
n1 = 1 (air), theta1 = 0 degrees, n2 = n, and theta2 is the angle of refraction.
Since theta1 = 0 degrees, sin(theta1) = 0, so theta2 = 0 degrees.
The ray travels straight through the medium without deviation since theta2 = 0 degrees.
